intro: Jacquemontia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and twining. Jacquemontia guatemalensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
